WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Hi,

We are closing this work item as this is no longer an issue since Prism 4.1 release (http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?displaylang=en&id=28950).

The change on type constraint in CommandBehaviorBase was implemented using #if precompiler directives: 
 - For WPF the type constraint is now UIElement. 
 - For Silverlight, type constraint is still Control.

Regards,

Damian Cherubini
http://blogs.southworks.net/dcherubini
WorkItem.Description:
CommandBehaviorBase for WPF should have FrameworkElement or even UIElement as a constraint for T.

Currently the constraint is Control.
WorkItem.Summary: Change Constraint for CommandBehaviorBase for WPF

Comments.Message: +1 Wanted to use the CommandBehaviorBase on an Image, adding MouseUp behavior
+1 Was looking to add command support for MouseEnter/MouseLeave on a Border (FrameworkElement)
